items.title: Medical Education in China
items.description: Dr. Zhang earned her M.D. from Chengdu University of Traditional Chinese Medicine and her Master's degree in Acupuncture from Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicineâ€”two of the most prestigious TCM institutions in China. She graduated top of her class from both programs. Her eight years of formal training integrated both Chinese and Western medicine, providing a comprehensive foundation in understanding the human body.

items.title: Clinical Practice in Shanghai
items.description: Dr. Zhang spent six years as an acupuncturist at the Shanghai Acupuncture and Moxibustion Institution, the largest and most prestigious acupuncture center in China. Selection for a position there is highly competitive, and during her time she treated patients with a wide range of conditions and developed expertise in complex cases.

items.title: Research at Vanderbilt University
items.description: After relocating to the United States, Dr. Zhang conducted postdoctoral research at Vanderbilt University, bridging her Chinese medicine background with Western scientific research methods. She has authored more than twenty publications and a book, Pediatric Acupressure.

items.title: Qi For Life Acupuncture
items.description: Today, Dr. Zhang brings over 30 years of education and experience to patients in Brentwood, TN, integrating traditional Chinese medicine with Western medical knowledge to help people achieve optimal health.
